summary: The Fit to Serve Act amends Title 10 of the United States Code to prohibit discrimination in the Armed Forces based on gender identity. The bill prevents the Secretary concerned from, on the basis of gender identity, prescribing service qualifications, involuntarily separating members, denying medically necessary healthcare, requiring service in one's assigned sex at birth, denying accession or reenlistment, or otherwise discriminating against members. Gender identity is defined as an individual's gender-related identity, appearance, mannerisms, or characteristics.
